name: 10 gauge Birbshot
description: The 10 gauge Shotshell is similar to its 12 gauge counterpart. It isn't has common though, in part to it being more limited in its applications. The notable diffrences between the two gauges is that the shell for a 10 gauge tends to be green opposed to red. The other fact is that the 10 gauge is catered towards bird hunting. While it isn't *as* useful for self defense, it still can be used to hunt or to shoot zombies.

name: 10 gauge Slug
description: The 10 gauge slug may be better suited for apocalypse life, it hits harder and penetrates more than just normal birdshot may be able to. Unfortunately, slugs are a bit more inaccurate compared to shot. It would be a wise idea to get used to shotguns before using slugs.

name: 10 gauge 00
description: The 00 (double ought) shell is very flexible. It is able to take down most targets in one or two shots and is fairly accurate. With this being a 10 guage it isn't as common as a 12 gauge load, but it does hit harder seeing as the BBs are heavier.

name: 10 gauge hull
description: An empty hull from a 10 Guage round.
